Class Game

java.lang.Object
model.game.Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents the main Jest card game engine and orchestrator. This class manages the entire game flow, from initialization to final scoring, including player management, card distribution, round execution, and game state persistence.

Key responsibilities:

  • Game initialization with player setup and variant selection
  • Round management and turn execution
  • Card distribution and trophy management
  • Score calculation using the Visitor pattern
  • Game saving and loading functionality
  • Variant-specific rule application

The game supports 3-4 players (human or AI) and can be played with different variants (Classic, Speed, High Stakes) and optional expansion cards.

See Also:
  • Player
  • GameVariant
  • GameState
  • Card

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Constructs a new Game with default settings. Initializes with standard deck, classic variant, and empty player list.

    • Game

      public Game(boolean includeExpansion)
      Constructs a new Game with optional expansion cards.
      Parameters:
      includeExpansion - true to include expansion cards, false for standard deck only

    • Game

      public Game(boolean includeExpansion, GameVariant variant)
      Constructs a new Game with expansion selection and specific variant.
      Parameters:
      includeExpansion - true to include expansion cards, false for standard deck only
      variant - the game variant to play (Classic, Speed, or High Stakes)

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main entry point for the Jest card game application. Handles the complete game setup flow including:
      • Save game detection and loading
      • Expansion pack selection
      • Game variant selection
      • Game initialization and execution
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used)

    • trophiesToString

      public String trophiesToString()
      Converts the trophy cards to a formatted string representation. Displays each trophy card's details including value, color, sign, and effect code.
      Returns:
      a formatted string showing all trophy cards

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player player)
      Adds a player to the game.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to add (Human or AI)

    • giveTrophyCard

      public void giveTrophyCard()
      Awards trophy cards to players based on trophy card effects. Each trophy card determines its winner through its effect logic, and the card is added to the winner's jest pile. Trophy values may be modified by the game variant.

    • distribute

      public void distribute()
      Distributes cards to all players at the start of a round.

      Distribution logic:

      • Round 1: Distributes cards directly from the deck
      • Round 2+: Creates a pool from remaining offer cards and new deck cards
      • Each player receives 2 cards and chooses which to hide
      • Handles insufficient cards gracefully with warnings

    • playRound

      public void playRound()
      Executes a complete game round.

      Round flow:

      1. Increment round number
      2. Apply variant-specific round start rules
      3. Distribute cards to all players
      4. Determine starting player based on visible card values
      5. Execute player turns until round ends
      6. Apply variant-specific round end rules

    • getRoundNumber

      public int getRoundNumber()
      Gets the current round number.
      Returns:
      the round number (1-indexed)

    • setRoundNumber

      public void setRoundNumber(int roundNumber)
      Sets the current round number.
      Parameters:
      roundNumber - the round number to set

    • playGame

      public void playGame()
      Starts and executes the complete game from beginning to end. Equivalent to calling playGame(boolean) with false.

    • playGame

      public void playGame(boolean isResumed)
      Starts or resumes a complete game from beginning to end.

      Game flow:

      1. If not resumed: Set up players and initialize trophies
      2. Execute rounds until no cards remain
      3. Offer save game option after each round
      4. Calculate final scores with trophies
      5. Determine and announce the winner
      Parameters:
      isResumed - true if resuming from a saved game, false for new game

    • makeChoice

      public int makeChoice(int min, int max)
      Prompts for and validates a user choice within a specified range. Repeatedly asks for input until a valid integer within [min, max] is entered.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum valid choice value (inclusive)
      max - the maximum valid choice value (inclusive)
      Returns:
      the validated user choice

    • getPlayersOrder

      public Player getPlayersOrder()
      Determines which player should take the next turn based on visible card values. Players are ordered by their visible card's value, with ties broken by suit priority (Hearts > Diamonds > Clubs > Spades).

      Selection criteria:

      • Highest value visible card wins
      • Joker cards are excluded from consideration
      • Players who have already played this round are excluded
      • On equal values, suit order determines priority
      Returns:
      the player with the highest priority visible card, or null if no valid player exists

    • getCards

      public ArrayList<Card> getCards()
      Gets the collection of remaining cards in the deck.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all cards not yet distributed or used

    • setCards

      public void setCards(ArrayList<Card> cards)
      Sets the collection of cards in the deck.
      Parameters:
      cards - the new card collection to set

    • getTrophies

      public Card[] getTrophies()
      Gets the array of trophy cards.
      Returns:
      an array containing the trophy cards for this game

    • setTrophies

      public void setTrophies(Card[] trophies)
      Sets the trophy cards for the game.
      Parameters:
      trophies - the array of trophy cards to set

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      Gets the list of all players in the game.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all players

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(ArrayList<Player> players)
      Sets the list of players for the game.
      Parameters:
      players - the ArrayList of players to set

    • getVariant

      public GameVariant getVariant()
      Gets the current game variant.
      Returns:
      the GameVariant being played

    • setVariant

      public void setVariant(GameVariant variant)
      Sets the game variant.
      Parameters:
      variant - the GameVariant to set

    • getJestPoints

      public static int getJestPoints(Player player)
      Calculates the base Jest points for a player using the Visitor pattern. This method traverses all cards in the player's jest pile and applies the Jest scoring rules through the JestScoreVisitor.

      Note: This returns the base score before variant multipliers are applied.

      Parameters:
      player - the player whose points are being calculated
      Returns:
      the base Jest score for the player's jest pile
      See Also:
      • JestScoreVisitor

    • setTrophies

      public void setTrophies()
      Randomly selects and sets the trophy cards for the game. Removes the selected cards from the deck.

      Trophy selection:

      • Always selects 1 trophy card
      • Selects a 2nd trophy if 3 or fewer players

    • getPlayersThatHavePlayedThisRound

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayersThatHavePlayedThisRound()
      Gets the list of players who have completed their turn in the current round. A player is considered to have played if their jest pile size equals the round number.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of players who have already played this round

    • countPlayersWithFullOffer

      public int countPlayersWithFullOffer()
      Counts how many players currently have both a visible and hidden card in their offer. Used to determine if the round should continue or end.
      Returns:
      the number of players with complete offers (2 cards)
